availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Peter Trisler Whittinghill (Ohio County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Ohio County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Frances Eshridge Herndon Whittinghill. Father of Remus T. Whittinghill, Nancy E. Whittinghill, Mary A. Whittinghill, James H. Whittinghill, Sarah J. Whittinghill, Helen Whittinghill, Burrell A. Whittinghill, Cicero T. Whittinghill, Luisa E. Whittinghill, and Remus B. Whittinghill. Farmer in Ohio County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Ohio County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Fordsville in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, District 2, p. 89 B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Adams Fork, p. 520.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Fordsville, p. 456 A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #26868.
